title: Factors are confusing
contents:
Introduction
I was browsing in stackoverflow today and came across a question about factors. Well factors were only one part of the question but it got me thinking about the whole concept of factors in R. So I thought I would take a look at the beginnings and some of the back and forth over time regarding the pros and cons of this data construct.
stackoverflow link https://stackoverflow.com/questions/63558161/multiple-time-series-plots-for-several-stocks-in-r-returns-an-error
Sample reference section reference. @Pocock1975a
Methods
Results
My most common usage of the todonotes package, is to insert an uncustomized todonotes somewhere in a latex document. An example of this usage is the command
References

Code

library(pacman)
p_load(DT, janitor, tibble, broom, snakecase, tidyr, data.table,
     conflicted, rmarkdown,purrr,ztable, hrbrthemes,readr, dplyr,
       magrittr, lubridate, zoo, mi, survival, ggplot2, printr,
       lsmeans, ggthemes,  knitr, xtable, doBy, nlme, reshape2,
       pander, pwr, tufte)
options(scipen = 1, digits = 2)
knitr::opts_chunk$set(
  echo = TRUE,
  warning = TRUE,
  message = TRUE,
  comment = "##",
  R.options = list(width = 60))
p = ggplot(diamonds, aes(carat, price)) +geom_smooth()+ 
  facet_grid(~ cut)
suppressMessages(print(p))

kable(head( mtcars ), "html")
library(DT)
datatable(iris)
1 + 1
p=ggplot(mtcars, aes(hp, mpg)) + geom_point()  
suppressMessages(print(p))
# clear env: objects and packages
rm(list = ls())
options(knitr.kable.NA = '',dplyr.summarise.inform = FALSE, 
    dplyr.print_max = 1e9,knitr.table.format = "latex")

opts_chunk$set(warning = F, message = F, echo = F, fig.width = 3.2,
       fig.height = 3,  results = "asis", dev = "pdf",
       opts_chunk$set(cache.path = "cache/"))
source("~/work/reports/templates/zz.tools.R")
options(scipen = 1, digits = 2)
# steps to add a simple table 
# 1) inside R block: create the table in tabyl(), call it tab1
# > dat  %>%  tabyl(var1, var2)
library(kableExtra)
# 3. kable(tab1, "latex", booktabs = T,escape=FALSE) %>%
#       kable_styling(latex_options = "striped")   
# 4. zz.figured(tab1)
# 5. outside R block: \newpage \includegraphics[]{./tables/tab1.pdf}
# 6. choose between the two versions. 
# 7. add a caption.  \captionof{figure}{tab1 caption}
tab1 = iris  %>%  
mutate(len = Petal.Length > 1.3)  %>%  
tabyl(len,Species) %>%  
adorn_totals(where = "row") %>%  
adorn_totals(where = "col")   
out = kbl(tab1,format="html",  booktabs = T,escape=FALSE, 
    caption = "tabled visit and week number") %>%
        kable_paper(latex_options = "striped")    
out
# follow with latex outside R chunk
# \includegraphics[]{./tables/tab1.pdf}

References


Pocock, SJ. 2005. “when (not) to stop a clinical trial for Benefit.” JAMA: The Journal of the American Medical Association 294 (17): 2228–30. http://jama.ama-assn.org/content/294/17/2228.short.
